sections.body: As a full-round action, an iron colossus can transform its legs into a massive, destructive track. Its speed becomes 80 ft., it can't be tripped, and it gains a trample attack that deals 4d8+30 damage. It loses its stomp attack. It can resume its base form as a full-round action.
sections.name: Alternate Form

sections.body: An iron colossus emits a 30-foot-radius cloud of poisonous gas, exposing creatures that start their turn in this area.Deadly Fumes: inhaled—save Fort DC 21; frequency 1/round for 2 rounds; effect 1d4 Constitution damage and sickened; cure 1 save.
sections.name: descriptor

sections.body: Not only is a flesh colossus immune to fire, but when targeted or hit by a spell or attack that would deal fire damage, it heals half the fire damage it would be dealt.
sections.name: Fire Absorption

sections.body: Spells with the fire descriptor and fire effects are unaffected by this field.
sections.name: Selective Antimagic Aura

sections.body: An iron colossus's ballistae don't provoke attacks of opportunity, and they reload themselves at the start of the colossus's turn.
sections.name: Siege Tower

sections.body: Standing 80 feet high and weighing 500 tons, iron colossi are the ultimate weapons of war.

special_qualities: alternate form, mythic creation, mythic resilience, siege tower
